title: Sri Lanka’s Alpha Fire Services debuts CSE trading
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s fire safety equipment supplier Alpha Fire Services Limited started trading on the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) on Tuesday (07) after being listed on the Empower Board.
The occasion of the first debut trading in 2022 was marked with a special bell ringing Ceremony with the participation of officials from both Alpha Fire Services and the CES.
“CSE established a dedicated board for SME companies with the view of providing an opportunity on one hand for SME companies to reach out for market-based funding
and also to broaden the scope of companies that are listed on the exchange,” Rajeeva Bandaranaike, the CEO of the CSE said.
“We at CSE are indeed happy that companies are now beginning to make use of the Empower Board.”

Alpha Fire Services Limited with a market cap value of 32.3 million rupees as of Tuesday (07) was the third company to be listed under the Empower Board after EML Consultants and Chrissworld were listed last year.
Speaking at the event, Samud Gunasekera, Executive Non-Independent Director of Alpha Fire Services Limited said the company was looking forward to the exciting journey
ahead as a listed company by entering the capital market. (Colombo/June 07/2022)
